meanings.definition: A person who is very active or noisy
meanings.sent1: The playground was full of bustlers running around and shouting.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were bustling with bustlers going about their day.
meanings.sent3: The bustlers at the party made sure everyone was having a good time.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was like a beehive, with the bustlers buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The market was alive with the energy of the bustlers selling their goods.

meanings.definition: A device used to agitate or stir something
meanings.sent1: The chef used a bustlers to mix the ingredients quickly.
meanings.sent2: The machine had a special bustlers for churning the milk into butter.
meanings.sent3: The bustlers in the washing machine made sure the clothes were clean.
meanings.sent4: The bustlers in the paint mixer blended the colors perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The bustlers in the blender turned the fruits into a smoothie.

meanings.definition: To move or act energetically and noisily
meanings.sent1: The children bustlers around the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent2: The workers bustlers to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to bustlers around the house in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: The leaves bustlers in the wind, dancing across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The students bustlers into the classroom, eager to start the lesson.
